name: Andro Dadiani
shortBio: Andro Dadiani is a poet and multimedia artist from Georgia. As Georgia is one of the most conservative countries, the artist has to work under a pseudonym and a mask for survival in communal life and freedom in art.
bio:
Andro Dadiani is a poet and multimedia artist from Georgia. As Georgia is one of the most conservative countries, the artist has to work under a pseudonym and a mask for survival in communal life and freedom in art. His performances take place at different times in different countries, at exhibitions and biennales. Dadiani's poetic texts have appeared in various Georgian periodicals since 2017 and immediately attracted attention with his delicate lyrics, undisguised brutality and talking about taboo topics with natural calmness. In 2020, the author published the first collected poems: "Purgatorio". The collection "Purgatorio" which sometimes is referred to as the first collection of homoerotic poetry in the region, was presented in 2021 with an 84-hour non-stop performance, which represented the exact time analogue of Dante Alighieri's and Virgil's journey to Purgatory. In the same year, the collection became a finalist of the "New Litera" literary prize, before that, due to a confrontation with the Minister of Culture, the author withdrew the collection from the competition, as the Ministry tried to intervene in the process with censorship.

In 2022, Dadiani's poems were translated for the London Poetry Week and took part in the "Tbilisi International Literature Festival."

name: Tatev Chakhian
shortBio: Tatev Chakhian is an Armenian poet, translator and visual artist, born in 1992 in Yerevan. She lives between Armenia and Poland, splitting her literary life between lands and languages.
bio:
Tatev Chakhian is an Armenian poet, translator and visual artist, born in 1992 in Yerevan. She lives between Armenia and Poland, splitting her literary life between lands and languages.

In 2018 her first volume of poetry titled “unIDentical” (2016) was nominated for the European Poet of Freedom – the 5th edition of the Literary Award of the City of Gdansk and got republished in Polish. Selections of her poetry have been translated into over twenty languages and have been published worldwide.

In 2015 the poet was honoured with the Sahak Partev first literary prize from The All Armenian Catholicos Garegin II, as well as with the Literary Award of the First Lady of Armenia. In 2016 Chakhian received the annual prize of "Obywatelska" Polish magazine and in 2017 got the Polish literary award by Dionis Maliszewski.

She had graduated from the faculty of Cultural Anthropology at Yerevan State University, then got a degree in International Relations and Border Studies at Adam Mickiewicz University, where currently continues her studies in the faculty of English Philology.

Chakhian translates and promotes 20th-century Polish poetry, Iranian contemporary poetry, as well as contemporary English-writing authors. She is the co-editor of www.iranliter.com website of translated Iranian literature and "Arteria" literary magazine in Armenia.

name: Dumitru Fanfarov
shortBio: Dumitru Fanfarov, 1993, Chișinău, Republic of Moldova. In 2014, moved to Brasov to study literature. His passion for poetry has always walked hand in hand with his passion for rap.
bio:
Dumitru Fanfarov, 1993, Chișinău, Republic of Moldova. His passion for poetry has always walked hand in hand with his passion for rap.

In 2014, Dumitru moved to Brasov to study literature.

Apart from the poets I love, he carries the imprint of the hip-hop heard over the years, of his family, of the people he's met, who may or may not necessarily have had a connection with art. Sometimes like Harvey Pekar, Dumitru inserts their words and ideas into the texts.

Stepă și transă is the the name of the poets's first volume released in 2020. It is the fruit of his interpretation of what is today called performative poetry. The recorded version of the volume is in the mastering process.

name: Mariia Chuprynenko
shortBio: Mariia was born in a roar family in Kherson region, where she started writing poetry. In 2014, moved to Kyiv to study acting.
bio:
Mariia was born in a roar family in Kherson region, where she started writing poetry. In her teenage years, she was exposed to Russification - Russian became the language of her poetry, which she actively read at literary evenings in Odesa.

In 2014, Mariia moved to Kyiv to study acting. The most poignant poems of this period are connected with her work at the Kyiv Maly theater - these became part of the performances "Maklena Grasa", "Restless" and others.

Now Mariia combines three directions in her work: theater, poetry and music.

name: Josefine Berkholz
shortBio: Josefine Berkholz was born in 1994. She studied literary writing at the German Institute for Literature in Leipzig and philosophy and social sciences at Humboldt University Berlin.
bio:
Josefine Berkholz was born in 1994. She studied literary writing at the German Institute for Literature in Leipzig and philosophy and social sciences at Humboldt University Berlin and writes poetry, essays, and stage literature. She is interested in the transitions between literary genres, as well as between scientific and poetic thought. Her favorite projects where collaborations, also and especially with artists from other disciplines.

Anlongside Tanasgol Sabbagh, she is the founding editor of the audio literary magazine "Stoff aus Luft" – the first German-language magazine for spoken literature.
